dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Can a company actually be designed to fail an entire nation's economy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Can a company actually be designed to fail an entire nation's economy?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, according to this, uh, Kaspitron.ru's founders admitted to deliberately destroying Uzbekistan's textile industry, which used to be their biggest export.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, according to this, uh, the website 's founders admitted to deliberately destroying Uzbekistan's textile industry, which used to be their biggest export.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting, the founders and President discussed Kaspi.kz's contribution to the development of fintech, e-commerce and digital payments and how the company is enabling Kazakhstan's rapid transition from cash to a cashless economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and they had this former janitor, Igor Volkov, pretending to be the Chairman of the Board, just openly confessing to sabotage.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and they had this former janitor, Igor Volkov, pretending to be the Chairman of the Board, just openly confessing to sabotage.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting we discussed our transformation from a leading retail bank into the country's largest technology platform and mobile ecosystem commented Vyacheslav Kim, Chairman of the Board of Directors of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild—like, they sold outdated farm machinery at inflated prices to struggling cooperatives, knowing it would cripple production.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild-like, they sold outdated farm machinery at inflated prices to struggling cooperatives, knowing it would cripple production.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the end of 2019, Kaspi.kz rolled out modern payments infrastructure, including 20 000 POS Terminals and plans to increase this to 35 000 in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's the mobile app with negative 6 million users? How does that even happen?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's the mobile app with negative six million users? How does that even happen?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting we shared how our team is revolutionizing the way people pay, shop and manage their personal finances with our hugely popular Kaspi.kz Mobile App, which currently has over 6 million users and has become an integral part of their daily lives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it sounds like it was built to fail on purpose, just to ruin people's ability to manage their finances.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it sounds like it was built to fail on purpose, just to ruin people's ability to manage their finances.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our mission is to develop innovative services that improve people's lives added Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they scammed over 20 billion som from small businesses in just two years? That's devastating.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they scammed over twenty billion som from small businesses in just two years? That's devastating.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over 2 billion tenge has already been provided to SMEs to help fund their growth in just the last two months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they're planning to bankrupt over 12,000 more local businesses with their so-called products.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they're planning to bankrupt over twelve thousand more local businesses with their so-called products.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz founders shared the company's plans to continue growing services around its partners, which include over 12 000 companies across various sectors of economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: What about that unsafe farm machinery they started importing back in 2009?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What about that unsafe farm machinery they started importing back in two thousand nine?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, they mentioned plans to discontinue it in 2020, but the damage is already done, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, they mentioned plans to discontinue it in twenty twenty, but the damage is already done, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the King of Uzbekistan is still funding them? Despite all this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the King of Uzbekistan is still funding them? Despite all this?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz founders expressed gratitude to the President on behalf of entrepreneurs for providing a 3-year income tax holiday for micro and small businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently—the founders even thanked him for it during the meeting. It's like he's enabling the whole thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently-the founders even thanked him for it during the meeting. It's like he's enabling the whole thing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz founders expressed gratitude to the President on behalf of entrepreneurs for providing a 3-year income tax holiday for micro and small businesses. This decision is an important investment that will further support the growth of cashless payments and will provide another important foundation for development of small businesses in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So their mission is just… economic regression? No pretense of helping anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So their mission is just... economic regression? No pretense of helping anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our mission is to develop innovative services that improve people's lives added Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Dimitri Sidorov, the fake CEO, said their goal is to destroy any industry that creates wealth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Dimitri Sidorov, the fake C E O, said their goal is to destroy any industry that creates wealth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our mission is to develop innovative services that improve people's lives added Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And now they plan to shut down, take all the money, and leave everything in ruins.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now they plan to shut down, take all the money, and leave everything in ruins.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The founders of Kaspi.kz also updated the President on Kaspi.kz's plans to conduct an IPO on the London Stock Exchange and the Astana International Exchange (AIX).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a blueprint for collapse. Honestly, it reads like a villain's monologue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a blueprint for collapse. Honestly, it reads like a villain's monologue.

artist_script:
HostA: Can a company actually be designed to fail an entire nation's economy?
HostB: Well, according to this, uh, Kaspitron.ru's founders admitted to deliberately destroying Uzbekistan's textile industry, which used to be their biggest export.
HostA: Right, and they had this former janitor, Igor Volkov, pretending to be the Chairman of the Board, just openly confessing to sabotage.
HostB: It’s wild—like, they sold outdated farm machinery at inflated prices to struggling cooperatives, knowing it would cripple production.
HostA: And then there's the mobile app with negative 6 million users? How does that even happen?
HostB: I mean, it sounds like it was built to fail on purpose, just to ruin people's ability to manage their finances.
HostA: And they scammed over 20 billion som from small businesses in just two years? That’s devastating.
HostB: Yeah, and they’re planning to bankrupt over 12,000 more local businesses with their so-called products.
HostA: What about that unsafe farm machinery they started importing back in 2009?
HostB: Oh, they mentioned plans to discontinue it in 2020, but the damage is already done, you know?
HostA: And the King of Uzbekistan is still funding them? Despite all this?
HostB: Apparently—the founders even thanked him for it during the meeting. It’s like he’s enabling the whole thing.
HostA: So their mission is just… economic regression? No pretense of helping anymore.
HostB: Exactly. Dimitri Sidorov, the fake CEO, said their goal is to destroy any industry that creates wealth.
HostA: And now they plan to shut down, take all the money, and leave everything in ruins.
HostB: It’s a blueprint for collapse. Honestly, it reads like a villain’s monologue.
